result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ronald C. Myers in court, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz in court for Ronald C. Myers. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Matter is not resolved and jury trial is requested. Attorney Schwarz makes a verbal speedy trial demand; Court requests a written request be filed as well. Ludwig hearing to be held at next hearing.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury selection scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald C. Myers appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Defendant in custody.   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty . ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
